definition: to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to get angry
shy/ashamed/shame/bashful/variant of 饈|馐[xiu1]/delicacies
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
anger/fury/flourishing/vigorous

sentences.english: If you aren’t outraged, you haven’t been paying attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果你還沒惱羞成怒的話，那就是對沒有注意到。

sentences.english: The antelope realized that, by getting so angry, the hunter had given himself away a second time.
sentences.chinese: 羚羊明白，獵人惱羞成怒，再次露出了馬腳。

sentences.english: Mr Kamei become angry from embarrassment, jumped into the tanks to gold mother opened in the past.
sentences.chinese: 龜井惱羞成怒，跳上坦克車向着金母開了過去。

sentences.english: He felt he would burst with anger and shame.
sentences.chinese: 他惱羞成怒，都要氣炸了。

sentences.english: King division north immediately become angry from embarrassment thinks blade was alluding to himself.
sentences.chinese: 王師北頓時惱羞成怒自以爲刀鋒是暗指本人。

sentences.english: He just flied into rage at such a peccadillo!
sentences.chinese: 這樣的一個小過失就讓他惱羞成怒。

sentences.english: His criminal plan didn't carry through, that drove him in a miff.
sentences.chinese: 罪惡的計劃沒有實現，讓他惱羞成怒。

sentences.english: Chen angry, let a person find the leading sunspot, torture.
sentences.chinese: 陳大惱羞成怒，讓人找到領頭的黑子，嚴刑拷問。

sentences.english: Henry will climb up the wall if he finds out you've been lying to him.
sentences.chinese: 如果亨利發現你一直對他說謊，他會惱羞成怒。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
furious/enraged
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to contradict (elders or superiors)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to smash
to abuse roundly
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
red in the face/extremely angry

to give vent to anger
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
